answers.answer: Yes those numbers are slightly high but not oppressively high.  He should be tested to see if he has developed diabetes.But that may not be the whole picture as you write here.  9 hours after lunch is a strange time frame.  Did he not have dinner in that time and had he not eaten anything for 9 hours ?!?!?!?!?!?256 so soon after dinner is slightly high but it kind of depends on what he ate.  If he ate a lot of carbs for that meal or they were carbs that were complex or simple

question: My husband has over the past few months, been getting very tired, dry skin and tingling/pins and needles in his hands and feet, sometimes to the point of extreme pain. He has always had a lagre appetite but it appears to be on the increase. Diabetes runs in his family with his grandmother, father and brother all carriers. We bought a blood glucose monitoring kit (finger stick) and his results from one test that we did 9 hours after eating lunch was 114, and the other 1 1/2 hours after dinner read 256. To me that seems abnormally high. could he have developed diabetes too?
title: Closet diabetic?
